title: Can we stop pretending like Miss Fortune got a rework
body: Honestly other than her W giving strut when activated, she doesn't feel even slightly different than she used to. Can we just say she got a visual update and put her back on the list for pending reworks?

replies.body: She's still being worked on, rework wise. They said they aren't going to rush it out, because they want to make sure it finally makes her work.

She used to have a unique build path with way more AD and ArPen than any other ad carry, but that was a long time ago :\

Please don't make her crit dependant. That would make her just like any other adc - totally broing. Let crit be an option, but let building raw ad also be rewarding... It's a unique thing she has and I would hate seening this taking away from her...

I enjoy her as an ADC.  She's fun and simple and if I don't feel like stressing a ton I can rely on her to roll early game and do some rather nice mixed damage.

If you're looking for things to hand her in the short run before you finish whatever you're doing with her, you could hand her Q some bonus damage on a chance to crit - it's already kind of like a bonus shot, but past laning phase you're usually not going to find a good time to capitalize on the bonus damage from killing a unit, so I've found it feeling a little bit underwhelming once you've run out of minions to bounce it out of.  This would make it more noticeable later in the game.

Other than that, her Make It Rain is pretty reliable as a zone-controller and a catching device, her R is good for wave clearing for tower protection and for applying some nice BC stacks, and the strut reactivation on her W has made splitpushing feel better since even if you've taken some stray damage, you can back off and speed yourself back up rather than feeling vulnerable.  There's also period where I've been able to use it to escape champs in general just from the bonus speed getting me out of range before their cooldowns end.  Despite what a lot of people say, she still feels nice to use right now.  Mostly the only thing I can say I don't like is she doesn't feel like a bounty hunter at all.

She feels like this:

http://gunsforeveryone.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/wpid-girls-with-gun-03.jpg

Over-sexualized gal with a gun.  Really no other identity.
Not sure if the Baroness is a good example. I think she had more personality than that.

Eh, regardless, if you didn't know who the Baroness was, that'd be all you'd get from it.

If you know who Miss Fortune's character is, there's more to her. But in game, you couldn't tell that for shit.

I like this but please don't donate points from her early game, (_basically destroying her early game_),  to late game, anything but that. I would just like to see a few early-mid game adcs, not most late game, (_even if ADCs are sorta meant to be late game_).

What if she could slowly turn her ult? Similar to how Vel'Koz ult works? This would give her a bit more control on her ult, and make getting caught in it more dangerous, simply by being somewhat harder to escape. While retaining its main weaknesses, its arc being much smaller closer to her, the fact she is easily interrupted out of it, and the fact she can't move or reposition during it. Teams would have to decide, are they going to make a full attempt at escaping it? Or make a full attempt at stopping it? It would be harder to just walk out of it THEN CC her in this case.

Alternately, dunno how you would do it, but being able to make her cone thinner or wider would be interesting. Wider cone would hit more area, but do less damage, and be harder to escape. While a smaller cone would be more focused damage, but much easier to escape and avoid, making each choice viable depending on the teamfight, or enemy comp.

I will say she's probably not too far off from being really cool. Mostly, she probably needs her ult to be a lot cooler, or just a few more high moments/optimizations generally.

The largest issue with Miss Fortune right now is that it takes far too long for her damage to ramp up. Her W increases the magic damage it deals every hit, up to somewhere like 8 times at level 16. THEN her ult does extra damage per wave, per stack. Is it cool? Sure it is, will she ever get to use it's maximum potential? most likely not. 

Most marksmen have their powered loaded up front, or in one single strike. Jinx gets a damage bonus immediately when she switches to rockets. Lucian gets a bolt of light that does quite a bit. A good comparison of power to Miss Fortune is likely Varus. His W does X magic damge on hit. It scales with AP (for some dumb reason), can detonate for percent max health magic damage  (which is strictly a worse off Vayne W, which is always active, and does true damage instead) . Miss Fortune is squishy, for her to get off 8 auto attacks in a fight is very hard, and only then does her damage start to become good. 

You have her ult do physical damage, that scales with AP, her W does magic damage, that scales with AD. Basically, Miss Fortune is a champion that demands an item that was never made. Hybrid stats, hybrid penetration.

It was a nerf with a band-aide. They took away her GW, because of "invisable power" even though people who played her picked her against comps with tons of healing. Not to mention they didn't even take the community's consideration into anything they did. Mf players have been asking forever to make it so her passive can't be canceled by minions.

Instead they got rid of a unique part of her kit and replaced it with a refresh her mobi boots passive? And they didn't even help her ultimate. She basically doesn't even have an ultimate.

level 6 her ultimate hurts like getting kicked in the nuts by an angry goat.

Other than that it pretty much sucks.
should I kick him just to prove it?

MF is not bad at all. I don't get why the boards insist she's terrible. Granted she didn't get a "rework" like GP or Fiora did, but she got some nice buffs and a visual update. That's good.

She's really not that bad guys.

Her issue isn't that she's weak, she's actually my favorite ADC, it's just that there's nothing she does that another ADC either can't do better or is at least on par with her and has another strength unique to them.  Add to this her immobility and she's a risk to take into a game too, she's not like Ashe who has hard cc, or Jinx who has insane late game damage.

There's just no reason to pick her over someone else aside from if you like the champ. Other ADC's can be lane bullies, have good damage, or have mixed damage. She needs a niche that she can fulfill.

She's got pretty amazing wombo combo potential. Also, most mixed damage ADCs deal magic damage on most of their abilities and rely on basic attacks for physical damage. Miss Fortune isn't like that. That said, her play pattern isn't real special. She mostly just basic attacks with the occasional R.

id have to disagee with her play pattern not being special to an adc... mf has a very unique positioning mini-game skirting around and half-flanking to land the second q bounce on a champ after killing a minion...  getting in close enough to make it rain without losing her strut ... it all feels very different than any other adc i have played.  that being said... she doesnt DO anything unique functionally.
While that's true for the laning phase, that play disappears afterwards, and Double Up essentially becomes a basic attack reset for all intents and purposes.
Grave's has similar wombo-combo power, the only difference being his AoE comes out as a burst and hurts a LOT more, which makes it much superior.

Graves: 550 (+ 150% bonus AD) physical to initial target, 80% of that to targets in AoE range

Miss Fortune:  125 (+ 20% AP) physical per shot, 1000 (+ 160% AP) total

Takes 300 bonus AD to equal damage on the first target, and that's not counting Impure Shot's effect on Bullet Time, which is an uglier thing to work out because of its stacking mechanism (on targets with no stacks, it deals 216% AD magic damage if all 8 hits occur). While Graves does have burst going for him, he obviously doesn't have better damage.

What rework?She didn't get one,it was just a very minor (& arguably pointless) gameplay update.
